pages.title: ⎧ Five of Wands ⎧
pages.text: Spirit of Strife$(br)      ♄ Saturn in ♌ Leo

A posse of youths, who are brandishing staves, as if in sport or strife.$(br)  It is mimic warfare, and hereto correspond to imitation, as, for example, a sham fight, but also the strenuous competition and struggle of the search after prizes and fortune.$(br)  In this sense it connects with the battle of life. Hence some attributions say that it is a card of gold, gain, opulence.$(br)  Unlike in the previous

cards, we do not see the staves all at the same level, or in any kind of formal pose. Instead, they point in different directions.$(br)  This conflict, however, is not destructive, but rather joyous, an outpouring of energy, it is really the breakdown of whatever is static and boring.$(br2)$(l)Divinatory meanings$()$(br)  Excitement, dynamism, movement.$(br)  Using conflict and friction
to break down anything that is dull or limiting.$(br2)$(l)Reversed$()$(br)  A conflict becoming more serious.$(br)  Anger, trickery, and possibly a feeling of betrayal.
